channel.title: IPv6 on Prasenjit Manna
channel.description: Recent content in IPv6 on Prasenjit Manna

item.title: IPv6 Deployment
item.description: Over last 10 years, IPv6 standards have evolved significantly. It is important to understand the current status of these standards, as ongoing evolution—driven by various real-world deployments—has rendered some earlier standards obsolete. The following documents provide an overview of IPv6 and its current standardization status. Primer - A collaborative IPv6 book by Nick Buraglio and Brian E. Carpenter, Book Copy in PDF, github IPv6 Operations ETSI IPv6 White Paper outlines best practices, challenges, benefits and the way forward - ETSI White Paper on website IETF RFC - IPv6 Deployment Status ETSI IPv6 Enhanced Innovation: Gap Analysis - ETSI White Paper on website ETSI - IPv6 Enhanced Innovation (IPE); IPv6 based Data Centers, Network and Cloud Integration - ETSI White Paper on website Join my email list to get direct access to new blog posts.

item.title: Books
item.description: Programming Books Skiena; The Algorithm Design Manual The longer, more comprehensive, more practical. It’s similar in that it attempts to teach you how to identify problems, use the correct algorithm, and give a clear explanation of the algorithm. This also describess the real world programming. McDowell; Cracking the Coding Interview Some problems and solutions, with explanations, matching the level of questions you see in entry-level interviews at Google, Facebook, Microsoft, etc.
